reviewText: I have many firm videos and this is by far one of the best.  Kelsie is a great instrucor and motivating in a good way.  The moves aren't too complicated and you work so many muscles.  I would definately recommend this one!

This one's tough from the get go, but Kelsie's infectious energy kept me wanting to work harder!  I used 8 lb weights and found them to be extremely challenging.  Her cueing seemed to get better as the workout goes on - parts of the warmup moved a little fast and caught me a little off guard.  She keeps in tempo throughout.  I have never done any kickboxing outside of some basic moves which appear in other FIRM workouts and would have found a tutorial helpful, although the moves were explained as they were introduced.  The workout was about 5 minutes shorter than the duration noted on the DVD case of 45 minutes.  I enjoyed this workout overall - I can't wait to work it into my rotation!

This workout is challanging-the toning segment is different. New different moves. I LOVE Chelsea!! She rocks! Very motivating in this workout-she really gets you going! I'm not a big fan of kickboxing (due to a permanent small tear in my LCL-it's hard to use my left leg for side kicks-so I avoid kick boxing)-but I modify my moves during the kickboxing. I actually used this one yesterday -but just the weights part-and then used the Sculpting Ball DVD workout right after. So a VERY good workout! The only thing I don't like is the backround. I miss the old firms where the statues and stage-like setting. This one has some new moves that will make things challanging. I used 7lbs and 8 lbs for the toning-and boy was it fun! A Keeper! A

I just did this workout today for the first time. What a fun workout! My biggest complaint is that it's too short. I definitely could have kept going.

Kelsie is very motivating and she's good at cueing. She did kind of annoy me by saying "I need you to do this..." over and over. But it wasn't too bad. The camera work is kind of off a couple of times...focusing on the beginner moves while Kelsie is doing the advanced moves, very obvious transitions, etc. I suggest that you keep moving after each segment because there's a good 4-5 second pause between each one.

The kickboxing segments are really fun. Again, I wish there were more. I used 10 pound weights for the weight training segments and that was quite a challenge. I really liked the ab segement as well, and I'm not always a huge fan of those. I highly recommend this workout. I know it's going to become a regular in my rotation!

This is a great workout.  Kelsie is a fantastic instructor.  The reason that I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is the camera work and the editing.  As another review stated, it is very obvious when they transition from one segment to another and the scene before the cool down seemed cut-off.  Otherwise, you will enjoy this workout!

but what is there is very good.  Kelsie Daniels is a superb lead.  She cues extremely well.  The workout is just under 42 minutes.  The warmup is about 5 minutes in length and then the next 27 minutes alternates between sculpting using dumbells and kickbox/cardio combos.  I thought each section was well thought out but I wanted more KICKBOXING.  The workout concludes with floor work (pushups and abdominals) and then there is the stretch.
I thought the workout went by fairly quickly.  My only complaint other than I wanted more kickboxing is the editing.  The transistion between the different segments was noticable.  Also, one of my pet peeves is not showing the instructor when she is cueing a new move.  This happen twice.
All in all, I really liked the workout.

I really love this workout.  It's one of the best ones I've seen from The Firm.  It makes you work hard and you can feel your muscles work and they'll remind you of their hard work even two days later (that's how I feel today - I've done it once now and can't wait for them to recover to try it again).
Kelsie is a terrific instructor; she's motivating and has endless amounts of energy.  Almost right from the start there are jabs and hooks to get your heart rate up, and right throughout the program, she teaches the cardio segments in add-on-style - that way you get used to a move and then add on other components to learn it faster.  When you do the toning, you use upper and lower body muscles at the same time to really burn fat and tone with maximum results.
Kelsie isn't annoying - she's very encouraging and that is a big help with this workout.  I really enjoy it and because it's under 45 minutes all up, it's easy to fit in the day and you're having fun that you almost don't feel like it's hard work.  The other great thing about this is you can modify it to your own level of fitness and capabilities.  I highly recommend this and will look out for other workouts from her.
Great addition to my collection.

I purchased this DVD to use in tandem with the "Dangerous Curves" DVD, and while the latter didn't work, this one sure did.  It's fast paced (even the warmup feels like a workout) and because you alternate between basic dance moves, kickboxing and strengh training, it's a nice all around workout.  I am sweating by the end and feel like I accomplished a good all over workout.
Love, love, loved it!

I love this DVD.  Especially Kelsy Daniels she is fantastic! (I have another DVD from The Firm that she is Leader on 500 Calorie Burn.....)
Wonderful CD!  Fast shipping.
thanks
This is a fun workout.  It really gets my heart rate up and I feel like I've had a good workout when I am done.

Not what I expected. There is little to no instruction on proper body form for any of the movements. Other Firm workouts are more helpful for beginners and slowly go through a new move with proper body mechanics. It seemed this instructor moved along quickly and expected the audience to know what she was talking about when a new movement was thrown in the mix.

Not too dancey, a little hip-hoppy rhythm, lots of kicking! I love that Kelsie isn't super sweet. She's just down to business but fun. It always feels like a good workout. About 30 minutes of cardio and then 15 minutes of push ups, abs, stretching. it's my go-to workout and I can always feel a difference if I stop for a week or so.

I really enjoyed this video.  I have been using the Firm DVD's for a year now and I figured that I was in pretty good shape to try this one.  Boy, did it really work my quads and gluts.

The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was because I wish it was longer.  The warm up and the kickboxing segments total about 32 minutes before the start of the floor work.  I wish they left off the floor work and made the kickboxing segment longer.
I love kick boxing but this personally didn't do it for me but I am in pretty good shape and workout on a regular basis
Good workout CD.  I have many of the firm and this is good too.  Sometimes I think the moves are too fast but I definitely feel like I've worked out when I complete the workout.

This lives up to its title. I own many Firm DVDs and this one is another good one to add to my collection. It's fun with lots of energy. Adding weights keeps you toned. Good sweat! You do feel pumped after this workout. Kelsie is fabulous and her instructions are easy to follow. Good, strong workout. Highly recommend.

A few days a week I work out twice a day so I classify my workouts into tough (only workout I can do in a day) or moderate (can do this and another similar workout in same day).  This is one of the tougher but doable workout DVD's that I own.  I use 3-5 pounds throughout and can definitely feel the burn. I like the combination of kickboxing and weights.  It is certainly effective.  The workout goes fast which is a plus. Kelsey is great as an instructor.  Just my type pf personality, not too abrasive or perky. The ab routine at the end is also spot on.  I highly recommend this workout!
Excellent workout, and it's a treat to see Kelsie Daniels as an instructor after seeing her as a cast member in The Firm Classics. She does a great job and I look forward to doing this workout!

I was needing something new in my workouts and I've always liked kickboxing so I decided to try Kelsie's DVD, Pump, Jump 'n Jab.  I'm SO glad I did!  It is fun, easy to follow and it is as difficult as you want it to be!
I know it is supposed to be a fast pace video but it's hard to follow and doesn't give much direction. I love the other Firm videos but this one isn't my favorite.
Just did not do it for me.  Didn't fulfill my cardio needs.  The moves are easy and instruction is good but at the end I was disappointed in the workout I got.
Another good workout from The Firm. Kelsie provides great direction along with an excellent stretch in the beginning and end. Not an extreme workout but you do sweat.
The master instructers at the FIRM are the best.  They make getting healthy and fit fun.  This one is really a lot of tun.

I am a "Firmer" since the original VHS tapes came out in the 80's (I think) which I still have.  The Firm workouts are great and intense.  I am slowly replacing the tapes with DVDs.  I highly recommend the Firm workouts.
I love the FIrm workouts! This is at the top of the list for favorites! If you are familiar with the Firm workouts it is easy to catch on to the rhythm, fast paced and a great workout!

I've been using the firm for about 3 months now because I no longer had time to go to curves every day.  So far I've lost 7 lbs without really dieting at all.  I love this one, it is fun and easy to follow.  My other favorites are Total Body Time Crunch, Get Chiseled, and calorie explosion (but that one is a killer).  This is such a fun, thorough workout that I'm tempted to get stuck in a rut and use it every day.  Kelsie Daniels is a great instructor, not annoying at all.  This is good for intermediate level fitness, if you're a beginner this would be hard but with practice you will get it :)

I'm a long-time FIRM user- and have come to really appreciate how these workouts not only burn calories, but make you stronger.  I would say that this is a Intermediate-Advanced workout.  While Kelsie does a terrific job reminding you of proper form- the workout does move quickly so you need to have a good idea of what she means when cueing.

I've read some reviews that slam Kelsie for bad cueing.  Actually, she does a good job, but for the beginner or those not familiar with the FIRM I can see how someone might get frustrated.  However, if the routine was super easy to learn- I think boredom would set in very quickly so I love how the she mixes it up and keeps you moving!

The FIRM likes to go heavy on the squats and lunges- which can be hard on my knees.  But I'm happy to say that this one is one is not.  It is heavy on the dips, but those are a little easier for me.
I agree with another review that questions the abs portion.  You really have to be able to stay up on your toes during pushups and planks to maintain form.  I tried to stay on my knees and found it awkward to pull my knees up to my chest.  Knocked one star off for this- think another kickboxing or four-limb set would have been better use of this time.

All in all-  am happy with this workout- it's a good length (about 40 min without the bonus 5 min)and will definitely hold a spot in my DVD rotations.

I tried this video for the first time last week and have been thinking about it ever since!  I have never said that about a workout before!

This was only my second experience ever with Kelsey as the instructor (also tried the 500 Calorie Workout last week and fell in love and wrote a glowing review), and she is now my absolute favorite and wish she had more.

The video was fun!  I loved the kickboxing moves, my heart rate was up instantly, but in my Zone 2 - Fat Burning Zone - so I knew I was going to have a great workout!  I really wish there were more videos out there by Kelsey, or ones that incorporated the fun kickboxing.

I was sweaty but smiling at the end, and since it was only 40 minutes long and my husband was home watching the kids, I decided to play it again!  I ended the second time still smiling!

I want to do the video again, but I always figure out my workouts a month in advance, print them on a calendar and follow them so that I can stick to working out, and so that I don't get bored with any of the videos.  Luckily this one comes up again in about a week!

I love the Firm videos because they let a person like - SAH and WAH mom - exercise, get strong and stay healthy, right in the comfort of my own home, which is awesome.  I either have to workout when my kids are sleeping (early morning or night time) but I find that I don't dread it when I'm doing these workouts - the treadmill I definitely dread!  I love all the Firm videos, especially this one!

The workout is pretty tough. Lots of low impact lunges with weights for great cardio/toning workout. The choreography is good, not boring and the workout is over before you know it. It doesn't have some of the dancy, boring movements like other Firm.

However, I took two stars off due to the instructor. Poor posture, poor que-ing and poor executiion of movements. Difficult to understand what she's saying and she also looks a bit scary looking to be honest.

Great workout but not my favorite instructor.

I am 58 years old and have been doing this workout for about a year and a half.  I have gained a lot of strength from doing this workout and my knees and hips no longer ache like they used to.  I can't do everything that the young women in the DVD do, so I modify some of the workout.  I pause the DVD after each segment and walk briskly around my house to catch my breath and I don't do the pushups.  I still can't do all of the ab work, but I'm getting better at it.  When I first started the workout, I thought I would never be able to learn all the moves, but with patience and practice, I did.  It is a great workout!  I really feel a sense of accomplishment each time I finish it.

This is a great workout, but if you buy the ultimate fat burning collection, you get this, and 3 other workouts as well, for half the price! It has low ratings because what it says on the back about what is on the DVD isn't accurate, which is slightly annoying if you buy it for those workouts, but it does have 4 fantastic workouts on it.

And I love kickboxing, but 431 calories in 45 minutes is unacceptable to me (I've been working out for 10 years and switched to home workouts w/ dvds 4 years ago), so I definitely want something UPBEAT AND KILLER. This is a great workout, but not killer... so depending on your fitness level, it may be just what you need!

This is a nice paced workout but not one you get lost in the steps....I had to do a little at a time, cuz it kicked my butt....other videos just slam through it, this one has good instruction and a good instructer...I would recommend!!

I do love this workout my only qualm is that its way too short...Just when your sweating bullets and getting into it, it ends...Kelsie is a great instructor and her cues on dead on...I use it on cardio days and I just combine it with another cardio DVD to get my full hour in.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because its too short...

I wasn't overly thrilled with this firm dvd.  I love Kelsey's 500 calorie burn workout, but this one was a little confusing.  She moves really fast and some of the moves are a little awkward.  I will say that after finishing the workout, I was definately sweating and could tell I had really worked out.  I was hoping for a little more kickboxing and a little less lunging with weights.  Don't get me wrong, lunges are great but it seems to be more lunging than anything else.  Im hoping this dvd will grow on me once I can get all of the moves down correctly.  On a scale from 1 to 10 I would rate this workout at around a 6.

I have taken Cardio Kickboxing lessons as well as taking on dvd's at home. I have been out of it for years and wanted to get back into it. I bought this thinking I could jump right in it because I know what I am doing right?....WRONG! This is def a great workout, but it's not easy to keep up with if you are a beginneror have been out of it for a long time.

I own about a dozen firm DVDs and do them almost every weekday morning.  This workout and the other one that Kelsie leads are my least favorite.  Her moves are easy enough to follow but the quality isn't the same as the rest of the Firm workouts.  The studio is different-- it looks outdated and the other Firm workout girls aren't the experienced ones you usually see.  This DVD is okay, just doesn't have the overall great feeling I get from the rest of the Firm workouts.

This is an effective workout which incorporates cardio and strength training all inspired by kickboxing. As I said, it's well titled... there's lots of pumping (work with moderate weights), jumping (and kicking), and jabbing (punches, hooks and jabs galore). The workout starts with a warmup and then alternates between pure kickboxing inspired sections and sections with weights (she suggests moderate to heavy but 3 or 5 lbs works for me), the weight sections also managed to incorporate some kickbox moves to tie it all together. There's also some pushups and ab work as well as a (somewhat longer than usual, which I found nice) stretch section at the end. For the kickboxing sections without weights one is geared more toward actual boxing, i.e. punches and such, while another seems to focus more on kicking and jump kicks. I didn't think I was the type who would enjoy a kickbox workout AT ALL, but I enjoyed this more than I thought I would. I'd say it's more kickboxing inspired than a pure kickbox workout, as she adds in other types of exercises and incorporates weights. She starts each exercise with a basic option, and adds on changes to make it more difficult until you reach the full intended move. She also gives low impact alternatives throughout. I have bad knees but was surprised to make it through the workout without needing to modify steps or feeling any strain. The instructor gives good instructions and cuing throughout. It was somewhat intense but very easy to follow along.

I deducted one star because I do have some mixed feelings about the workout. Part of me felt like it went by quickly for a 55 minute workout. At one point we went to the floor for ab work and I thought we were halfway done only to find out that after the abs came the cool down and stretches. However, I could have enjoyed the whole workout more. I by no means hated it, but it still felt like exercise to me. I think part of why it seemed to go by so quickly is because I was constantly wondering how far into it I was and when it would be over. I think it's a very effective workout, and a nice change from the usual aerobic/weight work, but I just enjoy some other workout dvds more, so I felt like I couldn't give it the full 5 stars. Still, it's definitely a worthwhile purchase.

Kelsey Daniels 500 calorie workout is my favorite Firm workout and I have loads of their workout videos.  So, I decided to buy this one as well to add to my Firm collection.  It is awesome -- it really gets your heart pumping --the moves are challenging, fun, and more importantly; safe.  So many kickboxing workouts incorporate unsafe moves that can really get you hurt; I know b/c I've been there.  This workout is great -- Kelsey's cueing is spot on and as always she is energetic and motivational.  I really really really (Firm are you listening??) would like to see more workouts from Kelsey b/c I love the intensity and can really feel the burn and she is just a great instructor.  The only negative about this workout is that I wish it had been about 15 minutes longer -- I'm an advanced exerciser so I really need tough challenges.  (beginners can do this workout too however) Other than that, don't hesitate to add this one to your collection -- You will love it, I promise!!

This is my first FIRM workout with Kelsie, and I enjoyed it so much that I think I will try some more!

Some of the sculpting moves are a little difficult for the beginner, but I thought that it was just right for the intermediate or advanced FIRMERS.

The transitions are very quick during the intervals, and Kelsie's moves require quite a bit of coordination. I can see how this workout would be very frustrating for people that are new to working out, the FIRM, or aerobics. I'm used to trying to keep up with the FIRM instructors for at least the first few times I do the workout, so that aspect didn't bother me.

There are a LOT of crunches during the cool down. Be ready for sore abs!

The kickboxing is fun! The sculpting is challenging! Kelsie is an excellent motivator. LOVED this workout!

At first, I hated this work out. I wasn't use to such high impact moves, but after time, and improving my balance, I really began to like it.
The kick boxing segments are fun and fairly easy to catch on to, especially if you are already familiar with Taebo.

You can't really heavy up on any of the exercises like you normally would in other firm videos, the movements are slightly quicker, and more awkward (so you have to focus on your stability), but I was surprised to feel it with such light weights.

There are definitely some great legs/butt exercises in this, the deeper and more concentrated you can get into them, the better it will feel.

HOWEVER, I have to stress that you be very careful with your form , some of these movements are a little awkward and can easily pull something, such as the "curtsies" that are executed fairly quickly, and the side lunges (which I have personally never been a fan of...)

Not bad for the newer Firm videos, but you still can't beat the old firm videos (with traditional weight lifting exercises that are simple and safe on your joints)

I really like this Firm workout. Kelsie is a really good instructor and she keeps my attention. No doubt about it she works you out from head to toe. So far I've only done this workout twice but that is because I alternate between my pilates and Killer Legs & Thighs which Kelsie is also the instructor of. If you want a good sweat and to get in tip top shape fast I would recommend this one. You get the pleasure of working out just as hard as you would at a gym in the comfort of your home. This workout isn't easy at all. There were times that I had to take a break but overall it is a great workout and I will do it again and again. This dvd is a keeper.
I have been a HUGE fan of The Firm DVD's for years. This one has been a GREAT addition to my collection. High energy, new & interesting moves, and definitely lots of calories burned.

At the end of this workout Kelsie says: "We not only burned a lot of calories, we also strengthen our bodies". This statement is so very true!! I love the kicking moves and the punches included here, they make me sweat. I bought this DVD 3 days ago, and I have work it out all 3 days!!

I have a mild dextroscoliosis of the lumbar spine which can make me very very painful sometimes, but the stretching moves Kelsie teaches me help me a lot to sleep well after every workout.

I recommend this workout to everyone who is interested on learning new moves and keep it on.

I am relatively new to The Firm, and have usually found their workouts to be too fast-paced (with moves that are too complicated for beginners if you're not familiar with them) for someone trying out their workouts for the first time.  Usually, I stop their workouts 20 minutes in simply because I've had enough of feeling totally lost.  Not with this one!  Kelsie Daniels hits it right on the mark, with moves that are easy to follow and do, and provides a nice combination of kickboxing and strength training.

What I loved:

1) Not shutting the DVD off in disgust because I couldn't keep up.  The combos during the kickboxing segments weren't complicated, and Kelsie does them enough times so you can actually get the hang of it.  The strength-training segments were just as easy to follow.
2) The fact that the segments using the weights kept my heart rate up, sometimes even higher than doing the kickboxing segments!
3) The fact that this workout is about 35 minutes long (The DVD says 45, but you really have 30 minutes of kickboxing/weight training, about 5 minutes of core/ab work, and then about 5 minutes of stretching).  I know some people didn't like this, but I get up early before I go to work (between 4 and 4:30 A.M.), and I need workouts where I can get a good workout in about 30-35 minutes.  This one delivers--there's no wasted time in the 35 minutes Kelsie has you working!

What I thought could have been better:

1) It could use a little more strength-training for the upper body; what I've noticed about Kelsie's workouts is that you do a LOT of lunges and lower body moves.
2) If you have never done kickboxing before (I started my weight-loss journey with Tae-Bo, so I am more than familiar), you will have a hard time keeping up.  She doesn't explain how to do any of the kickboxing moves; however, like I said, she does them enough times you can get the hang of them.

The good clearly outweighs the bad here; I felt FABULOUS after doing this workout, and felt like I got an intense workout, even after only 30 minutes.  If you're familiar with kickboxing and want a workout that will burn some serious calories--during and after the workout--you need to pick this one up.

I love The Firm and the 500 Calorie workout is one of my all time favorites. I had very high hopes for this one but it just did not deliver. It was not kickboxy enough and the segments seemed to drag on and on.
I really enjoy Kelsie as a instructor.  I love the Firm DVDs for travel.

Great workout DVD!  Highly recommend to anyone who likes to move and get a good sweat in their workout.

Burns up the calories and gets your matabolism moving!
I was surprise with this video, im not a big fan of the firm, but this was a good dvd

I am a true fan of the FIRM and especially of Kelsie Daniels, the lead talent in this exercise tape. I am not sure why, but when I first tried the workout, I didn't think much of it. However, after using it a few times, it has become one of my favorites. While it is true that it is under 45 minutes--probably closer to 40, for the time that you are exercising, you are working hard. It pushes you to give that extra little bit. Kelsie's cueing is good and I like the music.
I am beginning to really like Kelsie.  She's becoming my fave.  She always gives a good workout with good energy.  This one will not disappoint.  Great overall workout for ANY level.

Overall I liked this workout. It gets you sweating and your muscles burning. However, it does not last 45 minutes like the description says. The workout itself is around 30 to 35 minutes and then there is a lengthy stretching segment at the end. There seemed to be more time spent on squatting and lunging than kickboxing which is kind of waht it is billed as. The cardio should have been longer. I will use this dvd over and over but I will combine it with something else to get a long enough workout.

it's fun, challenging and combines cardio, kickboxing and weight training.  moves are challenging but not too choreographed that an uncoordinated 40 something RA challenged woman can't pick them up after a few tries.  It's tough but pays off big time.
Dianne
I really like Pump, Jump 'N Jab. You get a really good workout that is easy to follow and you can see results. Kelsie is very easy to follow. One of my favorites.

I thought there was nothing wrong with this workout. I had no problem following the cueing and was too busy working out to notice whether the set is 70s or whatever. The time just flew by, it felt more like 15 minutes than 40 which is still short. So take it for what it is; a short but good and challenging cardio & weights workout. What I like about Kelsie is that she doesn't fit the Stepford Wives mold like the rest of the Firm instructors (which are over-rehearsed robots with no personality). 5 stars for this one.

I really like Kelsie Daniels and this workout.  She alternates between sets of strength training and cardio intervals.  However, I felt that the cardio intervals could have been a bit longer with more emphasis on kickboxing.  She is not annoying or overly peppy and I have added this workout to my regular rotation of workout videos.

This is a great workout! The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is that I really think it needs more upper body work. The cardio is non stop and the warmup is better than a lot of workouts on other videos.  Beginners will probably want to start slow.

I really wanted to like this workout, but it fell a little short.  First, it isn't 45 minutes.  Including the warm-up, it's under 40.  They must be adding on this strange 5 minute workout 'bonus' that is on the DVD.

They have a new set...it's really bad.  It looks like a 70s sitcom.

I found myself looking for a bit more direction.  The cueing was a bit off.  There were a few new moves which was good because I think The Firm is getting stale.

All in all, it's a shorter workout that will rev you up for a bit.  Maybe for a day when you want to take it easy.

This new workout from The Firm is designed to be a fat-burning routine which blends kickboxing and sculpting intervals.  It is led by Kelsie Daniels, an instructor who has been a favorite of mine since back when she worked with Firm founder Anna Benson on the original FitPrime series.  The only equipment you need for the workout is a set of dumbbells; Kelsie cues you to use "medium to heavy" weights, but I found that sticking with 5-pound dumbbells throughout was challenging yet allowed me to focus mainly on the cardio benefits of the moves.  The workout is filmed on a nice, bright set, with big windows in the background overlooking what appears to be a building courtyard.  Kelsie is joined by four background exercisers, one of whom shows lower-impact modifications.

Kelsie gets you moving right away with an fast-paced warm-up that includes punches and active stretches; the warm-up lasts just under 5 minutes, and you are moving the entire time.  The first weighted series follows.  This segment begins with a squat/hammer curl combo, eventually adding a kick and then moving into a lunge with back kick.  The squat series is repeated on the other side and then the section finishes with some push-ups which include punches.  Next is the first kickboxing segment.  Kelsie builds up a fun combo in an add-on style; eventually, you'll do a jab-cross-hook-upper-knee-front kick-back kick-front kick, with the combination itself automatically moving you from one side to the other.  A second series using the weights follows, starting with dips and shoulder press, adding in a glute lift.  The next move is a crescent knee with opposite knee raise and side twist, and finally, there is a 1-legged squat with tricep kickback.  Then it's on to another fun kickboxing segment, starting with a side-to-side shuffle and three punches on each side.  After this, there's a dip with a knee lift that turns into an optional jump kick, and finally, a series of side kicks.  The final weights work follows, this time starting out with side lunges and triceps, eventually adding a roundhouse kick and then ending with a 1-armed row.  The segment concludes with another compound move, curtsy dips with side laterals, and a final balance move, side laterals while balancing on one leg.

At this point, the workout moves to the floor for push-ups and abs work.  I question the decision of The Firm to include this segment in a shorter workout like this one; I think it would've made much more sense to use the time for an additional kickboxing segment.  This section begins with a very short plank work series and then moves on to crunches, some of which were new an different, such as doing punches during bicycles.  Overall, however, this entire segment was less than 5 minutes long, so it didn't seem all that worthwhile.  The 5-minute cool-down is performed entirely on the floor, and it included some very nice stretches for the hamstrings, quads, and hips, all of which were definitely needed after the lower body emphasis of this workout.  The total time for the workout was about 42 minutes.  The workout also includes a bonus segment called "Every Muscle in 5 Minutes!"  It's actually just under 6 minutes long, and it features Kelsie working out alone.  She opens with a fast-moving lunge from side-to-side, adding on several sets of push-ups.  Next comes a back dip with an overhead press and then a front lunge with a row; this is repeated to the other side.  Finally, she finishes off with a slow side-to-side lunge to stretch.  As might be expected, this short segment felt kind of rushed, and I'm not sure that it really added anything to the overall workout.

Despite my ambivalence towards the floorwork and bonus workout, I really enjoyed the main body of this workout!  Kelsie keeps you moving non-stop, so even the weighted segments felt more like cardio work to me.  I found the music to be much more fun and upbeat than in other Firm offerings, and I was also impressed that this DVD is actually chaptered, something you almost NEVER see from the FIRM!  Although there are a few things that I think could have been done better, overall, I'm very happy with this workout and know that I will use it often; my final rating would be 4 1/2 stars.

I love the firm - especially Kelsie's workout's. She has become one of my favorite instructors. I tried the kettle ball yesterday and this one today and absolutely have fallen in love again with the firm. I started slacking with my excercise routine and this is just what I need to get myself back in the zone for my January Cruise. Great cueing, great energy, no complicated routines and time suits me well. I have heard other critique that it could be longer but honestly I find 45 minutes a perfect workout - but that's just me. Great job FIRM! I am loving the keetle ball workout and the Pump, Jump & Jab!

I really enjoy this cardio kickboxing workout.  I purchased it along  Dangerous Curves Ahead and Kelsie Daniels kettle bell/exercise dvd.  It complements the other two dvd's and I got a great workout.  I recomend this to anyone to enjoy cardio and kickboxing workouts.  Also, fast shipping.
excellent workout but the firm tapes are for people who are in decent shape already.

This is a wonderful workout. Very energetic from start to finish. I have a couple of other firm workouts with Alison Davis and she can be a bit boring although her workouts are just as intense. Keisha has amazing energy and motivation. This is my first workout with her and its great. I felt happy and can't wait to do it all over again with Keisa. She has inspired me to purchase her other workouts.
I am a Firm Believer and this workout met all of my expectations.  It's challenging and fun.  Kelsie Daniels is an awesome instructor.  This workout will not disappoint.
Not very challenging. Prefer Kimberly Spreen for kickboxing.

This one is my favorite video of Kelsie.  I use this on as my weekend video.  Kelsie will keep you motivated and engaged.  Buy it and do it and you will see what I mean.  You will definitely see results!
Really fun and gave me a great workout.
This program is excellent and effective!!! I am energized!!!
It moves a little too quickly for me.

I'm definitely a fan of The Firm workouts, I have 50+ of their DVDs.  Some are better than others.  This one was pretty fun, not quite what I expected, but still a good workout.

I love Kelsie, she's one of my favorite Firm instructors.  I'm fairly certain she's some kind of vampire, she doesn't age!  She looks as good as she did in the 80's "mansion" Firm workouts.  I am in awe of her arms.  Her cueing was excellent, and I like her enthusiasm.

The moves were simple enough to make it easy to follow along.  There is a modifier for beginners or those who want to keep it low impact.  Several sections use weights, Kelsie always states beforehand to use light-to-medium or medium-to-heavy.  I used light weight because it was my first time doing it and I wanted it to be more of a cardio workout.

My only complaint about the workout was there wasn't enough kickboxing.  The weight segments were good, but made it more of a circuit workout.  But it got my heart rate up and made me sweat, so I left feeling like I got a good workout.
This is a very advanced exercise, keeps your heart pumping

I am starting to exercise again after a long time off.  This is good for beginners or experienced athletes.  It is actually fun and goes by quickly.  I am doing it 4 days a week and really feel like I am making good progress.  Instructor is energetic and motivating but not obnoxious like most in workout DVDs.
This is a fun, well-cued, and thorough 40 minute workout.
GREAT!  I LOVE THE FIRM WORKOUTS! I HAVE BEEN WORKING OUT TO THE FIRM VIDEO FOR A LONG TIME. YOU WILL SEE RESULTS IN 10 WORKOUTS.
